page.title: 07FARMING IN EASSIE
page.content: The Vale of Strathmore is a particularly fertile part of Scotland. We have seven farms either partly or wholly in our area. They are large farms, being between 400 and 600 acres in size. They are arable farms growing barley, wheat, oats, potatoes, oil seed rape, peas, turnips and soft fruit. Cattle bred in our area include pure Aberdeen Angus and Charolais herds. Some farms also breed cross cattle. Many of the Aberdeen Angus and Charolais cattle are prize winners at National Shows. At Castleton farm hunters and riding ponies are bred and shown at all the major horse shows.
